TopicTitle: [0.23.5] Realism Overhaul: ROv5.2 + Modlist for RSS 6/30/14

Articles.Content: Says I need permission...

Nathan, I've been messing with the files to make them work with realistic tech progression because you don't get any stretchy tanks from the start now. But i've run into a problem with the superstretchTank_MFT_..... tanks, if i change the TechRequired to TechTreeStart instead of basic rocketry all superstretchTanks are available except the MFT tanks.

EDIT: When I change the names of the MFT tanks and also change them in the Stretchy.cfg the tanks all work!

Just one small problem, when you revert to launch it glitches when using the MFT tanks :/

I'm having a crucial problem with Stretchy SRBs. The tanks do not "stretch" the fuels too. The fuel mass stay the same. I'll post my info on pastebin.

Here it is.

EDIT: Here's the Log file.

Edited March 29, 2014 by O Nerd

Pireax: is your stretchy the root part? That's a known issue. Glitch how? Pics?

Duxwing: You need Real Fuels, first of all. I highly suggest using the mod bundler, it'll do it all (grab all the mods) for you.

O Nerd: Are you using RF v5 and Stretchy v9? Version mismatch would do it. Future reference: that's not output_log.txt. (KSP Folder)/KSP_Data/output_log.txt is the one I need.

Nathan, The stretchy was the root part so that must be the cause then, thanks!

Here are the files if anyone needs them: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3218566/RPL_MS18%20Fix.zip

They make Stretchy SRB v9 and Real Fuels v5 work with Realistic Progression Lite MS18.

Here are the files if anyone needs them: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3218566/RPL_MS18%20Fix.zip

They make Stretchy SRB v9 and Real Fuels v5 work with Realistic Progression Lite MS18.

You've got quite a few changes in that zip. I can spot the changes you made to the techtree for a few parts and the tech.cfg file -- can you detail what your other changes are before I decide to integrate this?

I changed all superstretchies from Real Fuels tot be available from the start,

removed the Stretchy SRB's superstretchies from the VAB as they are the same as two of the Real Fuels tanks.

I also changed the max width scaling in tech.cfg to be more in line with the removed stretchy tanks(KI-500, KI-625, etc).

Edit: You do really need RPL or else this doesnt work at all.

Edited March 29, 2014 by Pireax

I changed all superstretchies from real fuels tot be available from the start and removed the stretchy srb superstretchies from the vab as they are the same as 2 of the real fuels tanks. I also changed the max width scaling in tech.cfg to be more in line with the removed stretchy tanks.

Edit: you do need rpl or else this doesnt work at all

10-4. Thanks for your work!

Duxwing: You need Real Fuels, first of all. I highly suggest using the mod bundler, it'll do it all (grab all the mods) for you.

Thanks for your help and patience.

-Duxwing

First of all i wan't to thank all who have contributed to this truly awesome overhaul/pack/bundle-thing!

I have only had one problem/bug so far, and haven't been able to find anyone else with the same problem. Some of the resized stock parts (haven't tested them all, but might do when i have some spare time) have a tendency to revert back to their "original" size after the craft have been unloaded and loaded again (e.g. after switching back and forth between crafts). As far as i have been able to tell, the size is the only thing that is affected. Thrust, mass, node placement etc. stays unaffected.

I'm thinking it's a problem with ModuleManager or something like that. Any help as to why this happens would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

Schelde

I'm loving this but I've recently been having frequent crashes after events like quickloads, recovering vessels, going into VAB etc., but not every time. Not sure if this is the right place to post, but if anyone thinks they can help my crash log is here, here, and here and im using: FAR, RO (RftS), RSS (v5.5), RPL, AJE, DRE, RF, Stretchies, Real Chutes, Engine Ign., FASA, KW, B9, Proc. Fairings, NovaPunch, Asmis' ECLSS with RF patch, Remote Tech 2 with brooklyn's config, RPM, atmospheric sounds, AIES, Kethene, Lazor, Mechjeb, KER, KAS, Intersteller, Universe Rep., Texture Rep., Visual Enhancments, Texture Compr., RLA stockalike, Dtobi's shuttle engines, editor extensions, RCS build aid, fusebox & a few other small things. My crash dump file is empty, no idea if that's how its meant to be.

O Nerd: Are you using RF v5 and Stretchy v9? Version mismatch would do it. Future reference: that's not output_log.txt. (KSP Folder)/KSP_Data/output_log.txt is the one I need.

Nathan a quick question here,

Why did the MFT tanks not work without changing their names? Are they reconfigured somewhere else?

Duxwing, you're welcome!

Schelde: argh. That's the downside of non zero rescale factor and MODEL nodes. I need to rework it to not use that. It only happens when you use them as a root part though.

Blipser: try increasing scale in ATM. I can't look at the logs right now (away from computer) but it's possible it's a memory crash.

O Nerd: the non super stretchy tanks are deprecated. Use the start = 1000 fix I suggested to get around the stretch limits issue.

Pireax: what do you mean?
Sorry if I'm being stupid Nathan, but how does one increase scale in ATM?

I mean the Techlevel changes in their configs, the tanks with MFT in their name didn't change techlevel ingame unless I renamed them to something else.

Full KSP wipe and reinstall, using ECLSS this time, still have issues with probe cores on top of mercury pod (tried Explorer, M38 unmanned, Statputniks and QBE's) causing odd super flip up high and fast (100m/s+) collision explosion after entering pod from EVA. A parachute or stretchy tank doesn't cause this though, any thoughts everything else seems fine, just EVA pod reentries and probe cores on mercury pod (didnt have mk1 pod unlocked on new save to test it)

If i dont EVA its fine, whats causing this... i have no idea, really i'm stumped
